thread.title: Discover the Legacy of L’Année Automobile: 70 Years of Automotive Excellence and Innovation
thread.title_full: Discover the Legacy of L’Année Automobile: 70 Years of Automotive Excellence and Innovation

author: archyde
title: Discover the Legacy of L’Année Automobile: 70 Years of Automotive Excellence and Innovation
text:
2023-12-28 20:00:00
L’Année Automobile is one of the oldest publications devoted to automobiles since it was born at the end of the 1953 season. L’Année Automobile is the only work which, since then, covers current events in the fields of industry, sport and culture, the multiple changes of which she has thus been able to recount over the course of these seventy-one years of existence.
An institution that dates back to 1953.
The initiator of the publication was Ami Guichard, a Swiss journalist, enthusiastic, enlightened amateur, who from 1953 to 1982 animated and published this book under the banner of Edita, in Lausanne. From the start, Ami Guichard set the tone, understanding the world of automobiles from the angles of economics, design, sport and technology.
The publication changed its name several times over the following years, passing under the umbrella of Éditions 24 Heures from 1983 to 1985, Édipresse in 1986, Lamunière SA in 1987 before settling permanently under the banner of Éditions JR de Jean-Rodolphe Piccard from 1988 to 2004.
Between 2005 and 2008, L’Année Autiomoble left Lausanne to settle in Monte-Carlo under the authority of Christian Philippsen. Since 2009, the ETAI flag has flown above the publication, before the publishing house itself is owned by Sophia in 2022.
The editorial management has also known several leaders over these different periods: Ami Guichard from 1953 to 1970 (relayed by Günther Molter in 1963), José Rosinski from 1972 to 1977, Jean-Rodolphe Piccard in 1981 and 1982 and from 1986 to 2004, assisted by Roland Christen from 1983 to 1985, Christian Philippsen from 2005 to 2008, and the signatory of these lines from 2009 to 2022.

Sylvain Reisser, new “pilot” of the work.
Respected journalist, responsible for the pages devoted to the automobile industry in Le Figaro, confidant of all those involved in the automobile industry, Sylvain Reisser has taken over for the 2023 edition. He is surrounded by collaborators experienced in this particular exercise which consists of merging the spirit of the press, through the precision of information and the expression of opinion, and a know-how based on reflection and hindsight, the prerogatives of publishing.
And this, by resolutely distancing itself from the immediacy and staleness inherent to the Internet.
The new team fits brilliantly into this requirement for singularity.
